availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Shindler (Louisville, KY, policeman and saddler)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, saddler and policeman. Kentucky native. Married to Susanna Murray Shindler in Spencer County on December 21, 1854. Father of Julia Shindler, Sarah Shindler, and Ann Shindler. Saddler in Louisville in 1860. Employed Mary Bailey as a domestic servant in Louisville in 1860. Policeman in Louisville in 1861. Policeman in Louisville in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 2, p. 470.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 4, p. 426A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Spencer County Marriages, 1810-1931, Film #000482494, p. 263 of 425.
Henry Tanner, ed., The Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 224.
